result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis M Belisle

records.addlTxt:
2:42 PM Defendant Travis M Belisle in court.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has applied for SPD, but no one is appointed yet.  Case rescheduled.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
from SPD - not yet able to assign an atty
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:58 PM Defendant appeared.  Lexi Keyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has applied for SPD but was denied.  Defendant given information regarding court appointed attorney and is planning on applying.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.
Def appeared for drug screening.  Defendant is not eligible for drug court.

Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on June 13, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today.
  Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 2
  Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:46 AM Defendant appeared.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:40 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
